content.p: The term “Federal land” means any land managed by a Federal land management agency.

paragraph.heading: Federal land management agency
paragraph.chapeau: The term “Federal land management agency” means—

subparagraph.content: the United States Fish and Wildlife Service;

content.p: The term “road or trail” means a road or trail designated by 1 or more of the Secretaries for public use.

subparagraph.content: the Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the Chief of the Forest Service;
the Secretary of the Interior; and
the Secretary of the Army, acting through the Assistant Secretary of the Army for Civil Works.

section.heading: Interagency data standardization
section.chapeau: Not later than 30 months after April 29, 2022, the Secretaries shall jointly develop and adopt interagency standards to ensure compatibility and interoperability among applicable Federal databases with respect to the collection and dissemination of data—

paragraph.content: relating to recreation sites on Federal land; and
used to depict locations at which recreation uses are available to the public.

subsection.heading: In general
subsection.chapeau: Not later than 4 years after April 29, 2022, each of the Secretaries, to the maximum extent practicable, shall digitize and publish on the applicable agency website geographic information system mapping data that specifies, with respect to the relevant Secretary, all Federal interests in private land, including easements (other than flowage easements), reservations, and rights-of-way—

paragraph.content: to which the Federal Government does not have a fee title interest; and
that may be used to provide public recreational access to the Federal land.

content.p: The Secretaries shall develop a process to allow members of the public to submit questions or comments regarding the information described in subsection (a).

section.heading: Data consolidation and publication of route and area data for public recreational use

subsection.heading: In general
subsection.chapeau: Beginning not later than 5 years after April 29, 2022, each of the Secretaries, to the maximum extent practicable, shall make publicly available on the website of the Department of the Interior, the Forest Service, and the Corps of Engineers, as applicable, geographic information system data with respect to the following:

paragraph.content: Status information with respect to whether roads and trails on the Federal land are open or closed.
The dates on which roads and trails on the Federal land are seasonally closed.

paragraph.chapeau: The classes of vehicles and types of recreational uses that are allowed on each segment of roads and trails on the Federal land, including the permissibility of—

paragraph.content: The boundaries of areas where hunting or recreational shooting (including archery, firearm discharge, and target shooting) is regulated or closed on the Federal land.

content.p: The Secretaries, to the maximum extent practicable, shall update the data described in subsection (a) not less frequently than twice per year.
The Secretaries shall develop a process to allow members of the public to submit questions or comments regarding the information described in subsection (a).

Geographic information system data made publicly available under subsection (a) shall not disclose information regarding the nature, location, character, or ownership of historic, paleontological, or archaeological resources, consistent with applicable law.
The Secretaries may enter into an agreement with a third party to carry out any provision of this chapter.

The Secretaries shall work with the Director of the United States Geological Survey to collect, aggregate, digitize, standardize, or publish data on behalf of the Secretaries to meet the requirements of this chapter.

section.heading: Reports
section.chapeau: Not later than 1 year after April 29, 2022, and annually thereafter through March 30, 2031, the Secretaries shall submit a report on the progress made by the Secretaries with respect to meeting the requirements of this chapter to—

paragraph.content: the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate;
the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate;
the Committee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives; and
the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives.

section.heading: Authorization of appropriations
section.chapeau: There are authorized to be appropriated—

paragraph.chapeau: to the Secretary of the Interior to carry out this chapter—

subparagraph.content: $5,500,000 for each of fiscal years 2023 through 2025;

paragraph.chapeau: to the Secretary of Agriculture to carry out this chapter—

subparagraph.content: $5,500,000 for each of fiscal years 2023 through 2025; and

paragraph.chapeau: to the Secretary of the Army to carry out this chapter—

subparagraph.content: $2,500,000 for each of fiscal years 2023 through 2025.
